events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of January 9th involving their vehicle and another at a busy intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and description of the incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage the claim and coordinate further investigation and communication.
The customer was contacted and the claim officially acknowledged with confirmation of next steps and documentation needed.
Request made for police reports, vehicle damage photos, and witness statements to support the collision claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including images of vehicle damage and official accident report from local authorities.
Investigation initiated to assess fault, verify claim details, and evaluate vehicle damage for compensation estimation.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of claim validity and recommendation for partial coverage based on liability.
Proposed settlement amount communicated to customer reflecting estimated repair costs and policy terms coverage.
Customer provided feedback expressing satisfaction with communication and transparency during claim process.
Claim officially approved following acceptance of settlement terms by customer and confirmation of final costs.
Compensation payment processed and issued to customer bank account for the agreed settlement value.
Claim formally closed after payment confirmation and completion of all required documentation.
